summary: This appears to be an FBI interview summary (302 form) from October 25, 2019, detailing a witness's account of Jeffrey Epstein's activities, including the scheduling of massages, the roles of various associates, sexual relationships, financial arrangements, and efforts to manage visas and legal issues. The witness describes the environment in Epstein's homes and the dynamics between Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure of the investigation; described as receiving massages, having sexual relationships with women and assistants, and orchestrating travel and visa arrangements for women.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Communicated with those giving massages to Epstein in New York; later worked at his house.

persons.name: Jojo
persons.context: Married to Lynn Fontanila; was at Epstein's New York residence around 2004; was seen escorting women upstairs.

persons.name: Lynn Fontanila
persons.context: Married to Jojo; kept a piece of paper with first names of women with appointments at Epstein's New York residence; believed to have passed away.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by the witness as the only person Epstein saw as an equal; they had real conversations and he respected her; discussed sex in group settings and recommended books to other women.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Modeling agency owner who traveled regularly with Epstein; brought a young girl (approx. 15) to Epstein's island; encouraged the witness to be good to Epstein; had a close, sexualized relationship with Epstein; helped with visa arrangements.

persons.name: Parda Beskardes
persons.context: Immigration lawyer referred by Epstein to help people with their visas; Epstein used this to his advantage.

persons.name: Crystal Walsh
persons.context: Hired by Epstein to work in his Florida office while he was on work release; had a falling out with Epstein; allegedly tried to blackmail him and later tipped him off about an investigation.

connections.description: Epstein saw Maxwell as an equal; they had real conversations and he respected her. They discussed sex in group settings.
They traveled together regularly, shared sexual stories about women, and collaborated on bringing women into the US via Brunel's modeling agency and visa arrangements.
Groff scheduled massages for Epstein and later worked at his house.
Beskardes was an immigration lawyer Epstein referred people to for visa help, which Epstein used to his advantage.
Epstein hired Walsh to work in his Florida office; they later had a falling out involving alleged blackmail.
They were married to each other and both worked at Epstein's New York residence.
Brunel's modeling agency utilized visa processes; Epstein referred people to Beskardes for immigration help in this context.

events.title: Young Girl Brought to Island
events.description: Jean Luc Brunel brought a girl believed to be around 15 years old to Epstein's island. Epstein commented on the age difference between her and the witness.

events.title: Epstein's Jail Time and House Arrest
events.description: Epstein was in jail and subsequently on house arrest. During house arrest, he was allowed to travel to New York with the witness and claimed he would not 'do that' (massages) because he felt he would be a target.

events.title: Witness Starts Own Company
events.description: The witness started her own company, on which Epstein provided financial help.

events.title: FBI Witness Interview
events.description: Law enforcement officials, including AUSAs and agents, interviewed a witness about Epstein's activities.

events.title: Document Shredding in New York Office
events.description: The witness recalled walking into Epstein's New York office and seeing people shredding papers, though the timing was not remembered.

events.title: Crystal Walsh Blackmail Incident
events.description: Epstein told the witness that Crystal Walsh tried to blackmail him, leading to him giving her $50,000. Walsh later allegedly tipped Epstein off about the investigation.

keyFacts: Massages for Jeffrey Epstein in New York were scheduled around 11:00 AM and 4:00/5:00 PM, coordinated by Lesley Groff, with younger women arriving at his residence.

Jean Luc Brunel brought a girl believed to be around 15 years old to Epstein's island and Epstein commented on her age. Brunel and Epstein shared sexual stories about women and collaborated on visa arrangements.
Epstein used immigration lawyer Parda Beskardes to help women with visas, which he leveraged to his advantage, and told the witness he gave Brunel one million dollars to keep her in the country.
The witness described Ghislaine Maxwell as the only person Epstein saw as an equal, and that Maxwell recommended books like 'Story of O' and discussed sex in group settings.

Epstein's former employee Crystal Walsh allegedly tried to blackmail him for $50,000 and later tipped him off about the ongoing investigation, after which the witness saw people shredding papers in Epstein's New York office.
